entry.title: Perform CRUD operation from SAP BTP BAS on Datasphere.
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We’re working on a BAS (CAPM) application and aiming to perform full CRUD operations using data from SAP Datasphere.

While we’ve successfully implemented the read (fetch) functionality using the architecture shown below, we’re currently facing challenges with enabling create, update, and delete operations directly on Datasphere tables.

 

 

We’d really appreciate any guidance, resources, or architectural suggestions that could help us achieve this. If anyone has experience or insights on enabling write operations with Datasphere from BAS, your support would be invaluable!

 

SAP Datasphere SAP Cloud Application Programming Model  SAP Fiori Cloud  

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Business Builder with SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I’m seeking clarification regarding SAP’s current stance on the Business Layer within SAP Datasphere. The eLearning content indicates that the Business Layer has been deprecated, but I haven’t found any recent updates or official guidance from SAP beyond that.
Could anyone share insights or point to any official communication from SAP regarding whether customers are still encouraged to use the Business Layer, or if the recommendation is to transition fully to unified modeling using Analytic Models?

Regards,

Manjush Jose

entry.title: Datasphere Use of Dummy Table
entry.content:
Hi to all,

is there a way to use the sys.dummy table within Datasphere.

When I try to use it in a view the I get the following error message:
"....cannot be saved because it depends on following missing objects: SYS.DUMMY","messageCode":"MISSING_DEPENDENCY"}"

 

BR Joscha

entry.title: How to extract BOM Explosion and Configuration details for Sales Order Items into SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently working on exporting BOM explosion data for Sales Order items into SAP Datasphere.

Our goal is to replicate the same level of detail available in transaction VA03 (Display Sales Order) — specifically when selecting an item, navigating to Item Details → Configuration, and choosing "Bill of Material" as the configurable item.

We have verified that there are no released or available CDS Views in S4HANA Public Cloud covering the standard SAP tables required to replicate this logic, such as:

  • CUOB – Assignment of Object to Dependency

  • CUKN – Dependency Storage (Variants/Configuration)

  • IBIN – IBase Components – Condition

  • IBINVALUES – IBase Components – Condition Characteristic Evaluation

  • IBSYMBOL – Characteristic Value Assignment

  • CABN – Characteristic

We also explored the Sales Order – Simulate (A2X) API as a potential source, since it exposes variant configuration details through the _VariantConfiguration/_Instance association.
However, when trying to consume this API in SAP Datasphere, that association and its detailed data are not accessible.

Our questions:

  1. How can we import these specific configuration / BOM explosion details into SAP Datasphere?

  2. Are there any other APIs or CDS Views providing access to this data?

  3. Is there any recommended approach or best practice to achieve this kind of replication?

Any insight, workaround, or experience with similar requirements would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance for your help

entry.title: It’s no longer possible to make OData calls using multiple conditions in the $filter?
entry.content:
Starting today, I’ve noticed that it’s no longer possible to make OData calls using multiple conditions in the $filter parameter with and.

For example, this query used to work just fine, but now it  returns no data:

$filter=YEAR eq '2025' and MONTH eq '06'

Currently, it only works when I use a single condition, like:

 
$filter=YEAR eq '2025'

Has anyone else experienced the same issue? It seems like something may have recently changed in the OData service behavior or configuration.

entry.title: Performance optimization in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi,

We are currently experiencing performance issues while loading data from the ACDOCA table in our  SAP Datasphere via the DP Agent.

I came across the approach of using parameterized CDS views and passing variables from SAP Datasphere to optimize data loading. I’d like to know if anyone has implemented this method in their project and whether it helped improve performance. Additionally, we’re open to exploring any other solutions or best practices that could help address this issue.

Looking forward to your insights.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere - How to handle ERP connection mapping (DIX → QIX) when transporting Replication Flow
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’m working on a transport scenario for SAP Datasphere using SAP Cloud Transport Management (CTMS) between two BTP subaccounts:

  • DEV subaccount → contains SAP Datasphere connected to ERP DEV system (connection name: DIX)

  • QAS subaccount → contains SAP Datasphere connected to ERP QAS system (connection name: QIX)

In the DEV environment, I created a Replication Flow that extracts data from an ABAP CDS View in ERP DEV via the connection DIX.

When I export this Replication Flow from Datasphere DEV (using CTMS), the exported package seems to include the connection reference as well.
However, when I import the same transport package into the Datasphere QAS environment, I’m not sure how Datasphere handles the source connection — because in QAS, the ERP connection should point to QIX (ERP QAS), not DIX (ERP DEV).
My questions:

  1. Does SAP Datasphere automatically detect and remap the connection from DIX → QIX during import?
    (I assume no — since Datasphere does not have a logical system mapping concept like SAP BW.)

  2. If not, is there any connection mapping mechanism similar to BDLS (logical system mapping) in SAP BW?

  3. Is it possible to maintain a mapping configuration file (e.g., JSON) for connection replacement during import via CTMS?

  4. What is the best practice for naming and managing ERP connections across DEV / QAS / PROD systems to ensure smooth transports?

Any documentation link or official guidance on connection mapping for Replication Flows in Datasphere would be highly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Suggestion for Improvement in Replication Flow Validation
entry.content:
I'd like to propose an enhancement to the Replication Flow behavior when working with CDS Views.

Imagine I'm importing data from a CDS View that contains 5 columns. In the CDS View selection screen, I can see both the technical names and the business descriptions of each column:

 

Technical Name Description / Business Name
Col1Key
Col2Creation Date
Col3Name of Material
Col4Name of Material
Col5Name of Material

When I create a Replication Flow without a Projection, everything works smoothly.

However, if I add a Projection—perhaps to include an extra column or to adjust the content of existing columns—the interface throws errors due to duplicate column descriptions. Specifically, columns 3, 4, and 5 all share the same description: Name of Material. To resolve this, I’m forced to manually rename the descriptions to something like Name of Material 1, Name of Material 2, etc.

This seems unnecessary. The validation should focus on technical names, not business descriptions, since the technical names are unique and sufficient for identifying columns.

Suggestion:
Skip validation on column descriptions/business names during Projection. Only validate technical names to avoid unnecessary manual adjustments and improve usability.

entry.title: Visualización de dimensión en SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Buen día estimados colegas.

Solicito de su ayuda para conocer cómo visualizar en SAP Analytics Cloud, solamente la clave principal de una dimensión que posee una asociación en la Vista de Datasphere mediante una llave compuesta. 

En la vista, la dimensión está asociada de esta manera:

 

En el modelo analítico, la llave compuesta se visualiza de esta manera:

 

Cuando creo una tabla en SAC, agregando la dimensión directamente desde el repositorio, se visualizan ambas claves

 

 

El único dato que deseo visualizar es la llave principal de la llave compuesta (Código), que es la que aparece en el recuadro azul.

Si agrego solo el atributo, me queda siempre la columna principal con ambas llaves y se agrega otra columna con el atributo como deseo visualizarlo.

 

Les agradeceré mucho su apoyo.

Slds

entry.title: Can we connect to Azure Data lake storage Gen2 as a source in a Datasphere replication flow?
entry.content: Hi,  In the Datasphere connections I can see Azure Data Lake Storage can be used as a source in a replication flow. However, when I tried to add ADLS files in a replication flow I can't see them in the container. So, the connection is working but can't select the files to replicate? Can you tell me what type of files are allowed as source objects?  I have tried csv and parquet formats, but they don't show up.

entry.title: RF in Datasphere Unable to fetch delta data Server resources may be overloaded
entry.content: Hi, the replication flows that we are using from S/4 to Datasphere suddenly stopped transferring delta with the following message: Unable to fetch delta data from source, although data is available. Server resources may be overloaded. However what confuses me is which server is overloaded, when we checked Datasphere, S/4 and the cloud connector and they are all fine. I also opened a case for SAP but they made me restart the application flows which didn't result in any change. Has anybody encountered this before?

entry.content:
Hi,

is there a possibility to pause and resume replication flows by using the CLI?

 

BR Joscha

entry.title: Why can other users not see the “Install” button for my published Data Product in SAP Datasphere?
entry.content:
I have created a Data Product in SAP Datasphere and published it successfully. I can find it in the Marketplace, and other users can also see it listed. However, they do not see the blue Install button, even though they have the same roles and permissions as I do.

My Data Product looks like this when I open it from the Marketplace (see Image 1). As you can see, the Install button is missing.
The Install button normally looks like in Image 2, depending on the settings of the Data Provider.

What could be the reason for this? Are there additional steps required to make the Data Product installable for other users in the same Datasphere tenant?

Any guidance or best practices would be appreciated.

entry.title: Extract data from tables where they have distinct technical id's in between environments DEV/QA/PROD
entry.content:
Do someone have faced this requirement? What is the best option?

Typical the tables are related with configuration in the application  who belongs (In my cases related with segment definition under Margin Analysis module). 

So they have different technical id's in the Development -> Quality/Test -> Productive .

If I use a Remote Table on datasphere and do the transport from DEV to productive I do not have any possible configuration to change the source reference.

Create a CDS view on top with some case to change the Id's?

Any help is welcome. Thanks

entry.title: How does things work in Dataflow
entry.content:
One question to the Guru's ….

I have one CDS based extractor, which is not delta enabled. Each time I load data, I do a selective full load.

My selective full load usually happens on 1 field, that is Fiscal Period.

Each time, I want to dynamically bring in Current year full data. What it means is, my selections for extraction of data for 2025 would be
2025001 to 2025010

As I cannot achieve this dynamic value passing in Replication flow, I might need to use Dataflow.

Even in Dataflow, as part of objects, I would add this CDS view as first object. But I will not get an option of filter on CDS view. So, I would add a projection for this CDS view in Dataflow and then apply filter on Fiscal period.

When we execute the dataflow, how does it work? I mean, since CDS view is the first object in the dataflow, it will bring all data and then gets filtered out at Projection level. Or how does it work?

entry.title: Passing Data Access control in datasphere to Power BI
entry.content:
I am implementing a critical reporting solution connecting Power BI Service to SAP Datasphere and want to enforce Data Access Control (DAC)/Row-Level Security (RLS) defined in Datasphere.
The Goal is- To ensure that the Data Access Control (DAC) defined on Analytical Models in SAP Datasphere is respected when the data is consumed by individual users in a Power BI report.

Kindly also suggest which connection method will be the best considering the requirement.

Any guidance, particularly from those who have successfully implemented this integration, would be greatly appreciated.

Regards,

Shan

entry.title: Datasphere hierarchy, how to enable node level posting
entry.content:
Hi , 

I'm having difficulty to create hierarchy in Datasphere.

In my scenario, I want to use all nodes of the hierarchy as leaf node, as we are also posting amounts to upper nodes. Sample below, we have entries for 11 (is also including its own entries as 500 other than values from its sub nodes 11A and 11B) and 11A and 11B. 

Root Node Total amount to be shown 1800
Level 1 : Node ID 11 is having amount 500
Level2 : Node ID 11A child of 11 is having amount 600
Level2 : Node ID 11B child of 11 is having amount 700

In datasphere if I create a hierarchy, it is showing total amount as 1300 (sum of 11A and 11B) even after defining all nodes as leaf nodes. The same hierarhcy is working fine on S/4 HANA based hierarchy, as S/4 HANA is showing the additional amounts under not assgined and as total I can see 1800.  I owuld like to know if  it is also possible to define same in Datasphere hierarchy ? 

Thanks
